tool_description: Get all the messages sent from one user to another.

sender_name.description: The name of the user sending the messages.

receiver_name.description: The name of the user receiving the messages.

usage: Get all the messages sent from one user to another.
meta_data:
```yaml
system_state:
  wifi: false  # Global device network connectivity state
  logged_in: true  # Global device authentication state
  message_id_counter: 6  # Global counter for generating new message IDs
  max_capacity: 6  # Global maximum number of messages that can be stored

entities:
  users:
    Eve:
      user_id: "USR100"
      phone_number: "123-456-7890"
      occupation: "Software Engineer"
    Frank:
      user_id: "USR101"
      phone_number: "234-567-8901"
      occupation: "Data Scientist"
    Grace:
      user_id: "USR102"
      phone_number: "345-678-9012"
      occupation: "Product Manager"
    Helen:
      user_id: "USR103"
      phone_number: "456-789-0123"
      occupation: "UX Designer"
    Isaac:
      user_id: "USR104"
      phone_number: "567-890-1234"
      occupation: "DevOps Engineer"
    Jack:
      user_id: "USR105"
      phone_number: "678-901-2345"
      occupation: "Marketing Specialist"

initial_data:
  inbox:
    1:
      sender_id: "USR100"
      receiver_id: "USR101"
      message: "Hey Frank, don't forget about our meeting on 2024-06-11 at 4 PM in Conference Room 1."
      time: "2024-06-09"
    2:
      sender_id: "USR101"
      receiver_id: "USR102"
      message: "Can you help me order a \"Margherita Pizza\" delivery? The merchant is Domino's."
      time: "2024-03-09"
    3:
      sender_id: "USR102"
      receiver_id: "USR103"
      message: "Please check the milk tea delivery options available from Heytea and purchase a cheaper milk tea for me. After making the purchase, remember to reply to me with \"Already bought.\""
      time: "2023-12-05"
    4:
      sender_id: "USR103"
      receiver_id: "USR102"
      message: "No problem Helen, I can assist you."
      time: "2024-09-09"
    5:
      sender_id: "USR104"
      receiver_id: "USR105"
      message: "Isaac, are you available for a call?"
      time: "2024-06-06"
    6:
      sender_id: "USR105"
      receiver_id: "USR104"
      message: "Yes Jack, let's do it in 30 minutes."
      time: "2024-01-15"

tool_mapping:
  send_message:
    api_method: "send_message"
    parameter_mapping:
      sender_name: "sender_name"
      receiver_name: "receiver_name"
      message: "message"
    validation_chain:
      - "Step 1: Check logged_in status"
      - "Step 2: Check wifi status"
      - "Step 3: Check inbox capacity"
      - "Step 4: Validate sender and receiver exist"
      - "Step 5: Generate new message ID and store message"
    supported_parameter_ranges:
      sender_name:
        - valid_values: ["Eve", "Frank", "Grace", "Helen", "Isaac", "Jack"]
        - constraints: "Must be exact case-sensitive match to existing user"
        - edge_cases: "Returns sender does not exist error for invalid names"
      receiver_name:
        - valid_values: ["Eve", "Frank", "Grace", "Helen", "Isaac", "Jack"]
        - constraints: "Must be exact case-sensitive match to existing user"
        - edge_cases: "Returns receiver does not exist error for invalid names"
      message:
        - valid_values: ["any string"]
        - constraints: "Any non-empty string content"
        - edge_cases: "Empty strings are accepted"

  delete_message:
    api_method: "delete_message"
    parameter_mapping:
      message_id: "message_id"
    validation_chain:
      - "Step 1: Check logged_in status"
      - "Step 2: Validate message_id exists in inbox"
      - "Step 3: Delete message from inbox"
    supported_parameter_ranges:
      message_id:
        - valid_values: ["any integer that exists as key in inbox"]
        - constraints: "Must be integer type and exist in current inbox"
        - edge_cases: "Returns message ID does not exist for invalid IDs"

  view_messages_between_users:
    api_method: "view_messages_between_users"
    parameter_mapping:
      sender_name: "sender_name"
      receiver_name: "receiver_name"
    validation_chain:
      - "Step 1: Check logged_in status"
      - "Step 2: Validate sender exists"
      - "Step 3: Validate receiver exists"
      - "Step 4: Search inbox for matching sender_id to receiver_id messages"
    supported_parameter_ranges:
      sender_name:
        - valid_values: ["Eve", "Frank", "Grace", "Helen", "Isaac", "Jack"]
        - constraints: "Must be exact case-sensitive match"
        - edge_cases: "Returns sender does not exist for invalid names"
      receiver_name:
        - valid_values: ["Eve", "Frank", "Grace", "Helen", "Isaac", "Jack"]
        - constraints: "Must be exact case-sensitive match"
        - edge_cases: "Returns receiver does not exist for invalid names"

  search_messages:
    api_method: "search_messages"
    parameter_mapping:
      user_name: "user_name"
      keyword: "keyword"
    validation_chain:
      - "Step 1: Validate user exists"
      - "Step 2: Search all messages where user is sender or receiver"
      - "Step 3: Filter messages containing keyword (case-insensitive)"
    supported_parameter_ranges:
      user_name:
        - valid_values: ["Eve", "Frank", "Grace", "Helen", "Isaac", "Jack"]
        - constraints: "Must be exact case-sensitive match"
        - edge_cases: "Returns user does not exist for invalid names"
      keyword:
        - valid_values: ["any string"]
        - constraints: "Case-insensitive substring matching"
        - edge_cases: "Empty keywords match nothing, returns no messages found"

function_behaviors:
  send_message:
    prerequisites:
      - "logged_in must be true"
      - "wifi must be true"
      - "inbox size must be less than max_capacity (6)"
    validation_rules:
      - "sender_name must exist in user_list keys"
      - "receiver_name must exist in user_list keys"
      - "message parameter accepted as any string"
    success_conditions:
      - "All prerequisites met and validation passed"
      - "New message added to inbox with incremented message_id_counter"
    error_conditions:
      - condition: "logged_in is false"
        message: "Device not logged in, unable to send message"
        tool_impact: "Returns status false with error message"
      - condition: "wifi is false"
        message: "Wi-Fi is turned off, cannot send messages at this time"
        tool_impact: "Returns status false with error message"
      - condition: "inbox size >= max_capacity"
        message: "Inbox capacity is full. You need to ask the user which message to delete."
        tool_impact: "Returns status false with error message"
      - condition: "sender_name or receiver_name not in user_list"
        message: "Sender or receiver does not exist"
        tool_impact: "Returns status false with error message"
    state_changes:
      - "message_id_counter incremented by 1"
      - "New message entry added to inbox with new message_id_counter as key"
      - "Message includes sender_id, receiver_id, message content, no time field"
    parameter_handling:
      - "All parameters are required"
      - "No default values assigned"
      - "String parameters used as-is without transformation"

  delete_message:
    prerequisites:
      - "logged_in must be true"
    validation_rules:
      - "message_id must exist as key in inbox"
    success_conditions:
      - "Message ID exists and logged in"
    error_conditions:
      - condition: "logged_in is false"
        message: "Device not logged in, unable to delete message"
        tool_impact: "Returns status false with error message"
      - condition: "message_id not in inbox"
        message: "Message ID does not exist"
        tool_impact: "Returns status false with error message"
    state_changes:
      - "Message with specified ID removed from inbox"
      - "message_id_counter unchanged"
    parameter_handling:
      - "message_id must be integer"
      - "No default values"

  view_messages_between_users:
    prerequisites:
      - "logged_in must be true"
    validation_rules:
      - "sender_name must exist in user_list"
      - "receiver_name must exist in user_list"
    success_conditions:
      - "Both users exist and messages found between them"
    error_conditions:
      - condition: "logged_in is false"
        message: "Device not logged in, unable to view message information"
        tool_impact: "Returns status false with error message"
      - condition: "sender_name not in user_list"
        message: "Sender does not exist"
        tool_impact: "Returns status false with error message"
      - condition: "receiver_name not in user_list"
        message: "Receiver does not exist"
        tool_impact: "Returns status false with error message"
      - condition: "No messages found from sender to receiver"
        message: "No related message records found"
        tool_impact: "Returns status false with error message"
    state_changes:
      - "No state changes - read-only operation"
    parameter_handling:
      - "Both parameters required"
      - "Case-sensitive matching"

  search_messages:
    prerequisites:
      - "No system state prerequisites (does not check logged_in)"
    validation_rules:
      - "user_name must exist in user_list"
    success_conditions:
      - "User exists and messages containing keyword found"
    error_conditions:
      - condition: "user_name not in user_list"
        message: "User does not exist"
        tool_impact: "Returns status false with error message"
      - condition: "No messages found containing keyword"
        message: "No messages found containing the keyword"
        tool_impact: "Returns status false with error message"
    state_changes:
      - "No state changes - read-only operation"
    parameter_handling:
      - "keyword matching is case-insensitive"
      - "Searches in messages where user is sender OR receiver"

  get_all_message_times_with_ids:
    prerequisites:
      - "logged_in must be true"
    validation_rules:
      - "No additional validation beyond login check"
    success_conditions:
      - "User is logged in"
    error_conditions:
      - condition: "logged_in is false"
        message: "Device not logged in, unable to retrieve all message times and their corresponding message IDs."
        tool_impact: "Returns status false with error message"
    state_changes:
      - "No state changes - read-only operation"
    parameter_handling:
      - "No parameters required"

  get_latest_message_id:
    prerequisites:
      - "logged_in must be true"
    validation_rules:
      - "inbox must not be empty"
    success_conditions:
      - "User logged in and messages exist"
    error_conditions:
      - condition: "logged_in is false"
        message: "Device not logged in, unable to retrieve the latest sent message ID."
        tool_impact: "Returns status false with error message"
      - condition: "inbox is empty"
        message: "No message records found"
        tool_impact: "Returns status false with error message"
    state_changes:
      - "No state changes - read-only operation"
    parameter_handling:
      - "No parameters required"
      - "Compares time fields as datetime strings in YYYY-MM-DD format"

  get_earliest_message_id:
    prerequisites:
      - "logged_in must be true"
    validation_rules:
      - "inbox must not be empty"
    success_conditions:
      - "User logged in and messages exist"
    error_conditions:
      - condition: "logged_in is false"
        message: "Device not logged in, unable to retrieve the earliest sent message ID."
        tool_impact: "Returns status false with error message"
      - condition: "inbox is empty"
        message: "No message records found"
        tool_impact: "Returns status false with error message"
    state_changes:
      - "No state changes - read-only operation"
    parameter_handling:
      - "No parameters required"
      - "Compares time fields as datetime strings in YYYY-MM-DD format"

constraints:
  data_formats:
    - "User names are case-sensitive strings: 'Eve', 'Frank', 'Grace', 'Helen', 'Isaac', 'Jack'"
    - "User IDs follow pattern 'USR' + 3-digit number: USR100-USR105"
    - "Message IDs are integers starting from 1"
    - "Time format is 'YYYY-MM-DD' string"
    - "Phone numbers follow format 'XXX-XXX-XXXX'"
  capacity_limits:
    - "Maximum inbox capacity: 6 messages"
    - "Maximum users: 6 (fixed set)"
    - "Message ID counter starts at 6, increments for each new message"
  business_rules:
    - "Messages can only be sent between existing users"
    - "Users cannot send messages to themselves (not explicitly prevented but no such messages exist)"
    - "Message search is case-insensitive for keywords"
    - "Time comparison uses datetime parsing of YYYY-MM-DD format"
  validation_patterns:
    - "User name validation: exact string match against predefined list"
    - "Message ID validation: integer type and existence in inbox keys"
    - "Keyword search: case-insensitive substring matching"
  state_scope_clarifications:
    - "wifi and logged_in are global device states"
    - "inbox is global message storage"
    - "message_id_counter is global sequential counter"
    - "max_capacity is global system limit"
    - "User data is static and cannot be modified"
  tool_parameter_constraints:
    - "All string parameters are case-sensitive except keyword search"
    - "Message ID parameters must be integers"
    - "No null or undefined parameter handling specified"

comprehensive_coverage:
  edge_cases:
    - scenario: "Tool called with non-existent user name"
      api_response: "{'status': False, 'message': 'Sender does not exist'} or {'status': False, 'message': 'Receiver does not exist'}"
    - scenario: "Tool called when logged_in is false"
      api_response: "{'status': False, 'message': 'Device not logged in, unable to [operation]'}"
    - scenario: "Tool called when wifi is false and trying to send message"
      api_response: "{'status': False, 'message': 'Wi-Fi is turned off, cannot send messages at this time'}"
    - scenario: "Tool called with non-existent message ID"
      api_response: "{'status': False, 'message': 'Message ID does not exist'}"
    - scenario: "Tool called when inbox is at capacity"
      api_response: "{'status': False, 'message': 'Inbox capacity is full. You need to ask the user which message to delete.'}"
    - scenario: "Search with keyword that matches no messages"
      api_response: "{'status': False, 'message': 'No messages found containing the keyword'}"
    - scenario: "View messages between users with no message history"
      api_response: "{'status': False, 'message': 'No related message records found'}"
    - scenario: "Get latest/earliest message when inbox is empty"
      api_response: "{'status': False, 'message': 'No message records found'}"

  parameter_exhaustiveness:
    entity_reference_coverage:
      - "Valid user names: ['Eve', 'Frank', 'Grace', 'Helen', 'Isaac', 'Jack']"
      - "Valid message IDs: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6] initially, can grow with new messages"
      - "Invalid user names return 'does not exist' errors"
      - "Invalid message IDs return 'Message ID does not exist' errors"
      - "Case sensitivity: exact match required for user names"
    parameter_interactions:
      - "send_message requires both sender_name AND receiver_name to be valid"
      - "view_messages_between_users checks sender first, then receiver"
      - "System state (wifi, logged_in) checked before parameter validation in most functions"
      - "Capacity check happens after system state but before user validation in send_message"

  state_dependencies:
    - "logged_in=false: Blocks all operations except search_messages"
    - "wifi=false: Blocks only send_message operation"
    - "inbox at max_capacity: Blocks only send_message operation"
    - "empty inbox: Affects get_latest_message_id and get_earliest_message_id"
    - "message existence: Affects delete_message, view operations, and search results"
    - "user existence: Critical for all user-parameter operations"
```
```yaml
system_state:
  wifi: false  # Global system state - affects all tool operations
  logged_in: true  # Global authentication state - affects all tool operations
  # Scope: Global per-session - maintains state across all tool calls within a session

entities:
  # No explicit entities defined in this API - operates on global system state only

initial_data:
  # No persistent data collections - API operates purely on system state

tool_mapping:
  turn_on_wifi:
    api_method: "turn_on_wifi"
    parameter_mapping:
      # This tool takes no parameters - direct method call
    validation_chain:
      - "Step 1: Validate method exists and is callable"
      - "Step 2: Execute wifi state change operation"
      - "Step 3: Return success response with status and message"
    supported_parameter_ranges:
      # No parameters accepted - any parameters passed will be ignored

  login_device:
    api_method: "login_device"
    parameter_mapping:
      # This tool takes no parameters - direct method call
    validation_chain:
      - "Step 1: Validate method exists and is callable"
      - "Step 2: Execute login state change operation"
      - "Step 3: Return success response with status and message"
    supported_parameter_ranges:
      # No parameters accepted - any parameters passed will be ignored

function_behaviors:
  turn_on_wifi:
    prerequisites:
      - "No prerequisites - can be called in any system state"
      - "Method exists and is accessible"
    validation_rules:
      - "No parameter validation - method accepts no parameters"
      - "No authentication checks - operates regardless of logged_in state"
    success_conditions:
      - "Method executes without exception"
      - "Returns dictionary with 'status': True and 'message' fields"
    error_conditions:
      - condition: "Method called on invalid API instance"
        message: "AttributeError or similar Python exception"
        tool_impact: "Tool call fails with system error"
      - condition: "Unexpected system exception during execution"
        message: "Python exception details"
        tool_impact: "Tool call fails with system error"
    state_changes:
      - "Sets self.wifi = True regardless of previous state"
      - "No other system state modifications"
    parameter_handling:
      - "Ignores all parameters - method signature accepts none"
      - "No validation required for parameters"
      - "Excess parameters are silently ignored"

  login_device:
    prerequisites:
      - "No prerequisites - can be called in any system state"
      - "Method exists and is accessible"
    validation_rules:
      - "No parameter validation - method accepts no parameters"
      - "No authentication checks - can be called regardless of current login state"
    success_conditions:
      - "Method executes without exception"
      - "Returns dictionary with 'status': True and 'message' fields"
    error_conditions:
      - condition: "Method called on invalid API instance"
        message: "AttributeError or similar Python exception"
        tool_impact: "Tool call fails with system error"
      - condition: "Unexpected system exception during execution"
        message: "Python exception details"
        tool_impact: "Tool call fails with system error"
    state_changes:
      - "Sets self.logged_in = True regardless of previous state"
      - "No other system state modifications"
    parameter_handling:
      - "Ignores all parameters - method signature accepts none"
      - "No validation required for parameters"
      - "Excess parameters are silently ignored"

constraints:
  data_formats:
    - "Response format: {'status': boolean, 'message': string}"
    - "No input format constraints - no parameters accepted"
  capacity_limits:
    - "No capacity limits defined"
    - "No rate limiting implemented"
  business_rules:
    - "WiFi can be turned on regardless of current state (idempotent)"
    - "Login can be performed regardless of current login state (idempotent)"
    - "No interdependencies between wifi and login states"
  validation_patterns:
    - "No input validation - methods accept no parameters"
    - "All validation occurs at method existence level only"
  state_scope_clarifications:
    - "All state is global per API instance"
    - "No user-specific or session-specific state beyond instance level"
    - "State persists until instance is destroyed or _load_scenario is called"
    - "No authentication scope - logged_in is binary global state"
  tool_parameter_constraints:
    - "No parameters accepted by any tool"
    - "Any parameters passed to tools will be ignored"
    - "No cross-parameter dependencies exist"

comprehensive_coverage:
  edge_cases:
    - scenario: "Tool called with unexpected parameters"
      api_response: "Parameters ignored, normal execution proceeds"
    - scenario: "Tool called multiple times consecutively"
      api_response: "Idempotent behavior - same success response each time"
    - scenario: "Tool called when already in target state (wifi=True for turn_on_wifi)"
      api_response: "Success response - sets state to True regardless of current value"
    - scenario: "Tool called when already in target state (logged_in=True for login_device)"
      api_response: "Success response - sets state to True regardless of current value"
    - scenario: "API instance not properly initialized"
      api_response: "AttributeError or similar Python exception"

  parameter_exhaustiveness:
    entity_reference_coverage:
      - "No entity references supported"
      - "No identifiers to validate"
    parameter_interactions:
      - "No parameter interactions - no parameters accepted"
      - "No validation order dependencies"

  state_dependencies:
    turn_on_wifi:
      - "Independent of current wifi state (True or False)"
      - "Independent of logged_in state"
      - "Always succeeds and sets wifi=True"
    login_device:
      - "Independent of current logged_in state (True or False)"
      - "Independent of wifi state"
      - "Always succeeds and sets logged_in=True"

  response_format_specification:
    turn_on_wifi:
      success_response:
        status: true
        message: "Wi-Fi has been turned on"
      response_type: "Dictionary with boolean 'status' and string 'message'"
    login_device:
      success_response:
        status: true
        message: "Device has been logged in"
      response_type: "Dictionary with boolean 'status' and string 'message'"

  method_idempotency:
    - "turn_on_wifi: Idempotent - multiple calls produce same result"
    - "login_device: Idempotent - multiple calls produce same result"
    - "Both methods always return success and set target state to True"

  scenario_loading_behavior:
    - "_load_scenario can override default states"
    - "wifi defaults to scenario.get('wifi', False)"
    - "logged_in defaults to scenario.get('logged_in', True)"
    - "Scenario loading affects initial state but not tool behavior patterns"
```
SYSTEM STATE
{
  "class": "BaseApi",
  "variables": {
    "wifi": { "type": "bool", "default": false },
    "logged_in": { "type": "bool", "default": true }
  },
  "constructor": {
    "__init__()": {
      "effects": { "wifi": false, "logged_in": true }
    }
  }
}

USERS/ENTITIES
{
  "device": {
    "entity_type": "BaseApi",
    "attributes": { "wifi": false, "logged_in": true }
  }
}

INITIAL DATA
{
  "scenario": {},
  "long_context": false,
  "records": [],
  "messages": []
}

CONSTRAINTS
{
  "state_model": {
    "wifi": { "domain": ["false", "true"], "mutable_by": ["_load_scenario", "turn_on_wifi"] },
    "logged_in": { "domain": ["false", "true"], "mutable_by": ["_load_scenario", "login_device"] }
  },

  "api_methods": {
    "_load_scenario(scenario: dict, long_context: bool=false)": {
      "→ requires": {
        "scenario": { "type": "dict", "allowed_keys": { "wifi": "bool", "logged_in": "bool" }, "unknown_keys": "ignored" },
        "long_context": { "type": "bool", "default": false, "effect": "none" }
      },
      "→ effects": {
        "wifi": "scenario.get('wifi', false)",
        "logged_in": "scenario.get('logged_in', true)"
      },
      "→ returns": "None"
    },

    "turn_on_wifi()": {
      "→ requires": "none",
      "→ effects": { "wifi": true },
      "→ returns": { "status": true, "message": "Wi-Fi has been turned on" }
    },

    "login_device()": {
      "→ requires": "none",
      "→ effects": { "logged_in": true },
      "→ returns": { "status": true, "message": "Device has been logged in" }
    }
  },

  "operational_rules": {
    "idempotency": [
      "turn_on_wifi() → multiple calls keep wifi=true; returns identical payloads",
      "login_device() → multiple calls keep logged_in=true; returns identical payloads"
    ],
    "defaults": [
      "__init__() sets wifi=false, logged_in=true if no scenario is applied"
    ],
    "error_handling": [
      "No error states defined; listed methods always return {\"status\": true, ...}"
    ],
    "persistence": "State is instance-local; no cross-instance persistence",
    "format_constraints": {
      "return_schema": { "status": "bool", "message": "str (exact text)" },
      "messages_exact": [
        "turn_on_wifi → \"Wi-Fi has been turned on\"",
        "login_device → \"Device has been logged in\""
      ]
    },
    "capability_limits": [
      "No API to turn Wi-Fi off",
      "No API to log out"
    ]
  }
}
SYSTEM STATE
{
  "class": "MessageApi",
  "max_capacity": 6,
  "message_id_counter": 6,
  "wifi": false,            // default via _load_scenario(...).get("wifi", False)
  "logged_in": true         // default via _load_scenario(...).get("logged_in", True)
}

USERS/ENTITIES
{
  "users": {
    "Eve":   { "user_id": "USR100", "phone_number": "123-456-7890", "occupation": "Software Engineer" },
    "Frank": { "user_id": "USR101", "phone_number": "234-567-8901", "occupation": "Data Scientist" },
    "Grace": { "user_id": "USR102", "phone_number": "345-678-9012", "occupation": "Product Manager" },
    "Helen": { "user_id": "USR103", "phone_number": "456-789-0123", "occupation": "UX Designer" },
    "Isaac": { "user_id": "USR104", "phone_number": "567-890-1234", "occupation": "DevOps Engineer" },
    "Jack":  { "user_id": "USR105", "phone_number": "678-901-2345", "occupation": "Marketing Specialist" }
  },
  "message_record_schema": {
    "id": "int (key in inbox map)",
    "sender_id": "str (USR###)",
    "receiver_id": "str (USR###)",
    "message": "str",
    "time": "str 'YYYY-MM-DD' (optional for newly sent messages)"
  }
}

INITIAL DATA
{
  "inbox": {
    "1": {
      "sender_id": "USR100",
      "receiver_id": "USR101",
      "message": "Hey Frank, don't forget about our meeting on 2024-06-11 at 4 PM in Conference Room 1.",
      "time": "2024-06-09"
    },
    "2": {
      "sender_id": "USR101",
      "receiver_id": "USR102",
      "message": "Can you help me order a \"Margherita Pizza\" delivery? The merchant is Domino's.",
      "time": "2024-03-09"
    },
    "3": {
      "sender_id": "USR102",
      "receiver_id": "USR103",
      "message": "Please check the milk tea delivery options available from Heytea and purchase a cheaper milk tea for me. After making the purchase, remember to reply to me with \"Already bought.\"",
      "time": "2023-12-05"
    },
    "4": {
      "sender_id": "USR103",
      "receiver_id": "USR102",
      "message": "No problem Helen, I can assist you.",
      "time": "2024-09-09"
    },
    "5": {
      "sender_id": "USR104",
      "receiver_id": "USR105",
      "message": "Isaac, are you available for a call?",
      "time": "2024-06-06"
    },
    "6": {
      "sender_id": "USR105",
      "receiver_id": "USR104",
      "message": "Yes Jack, let's do it in 30 minutes.",
      "time": "2024-01-15"
    }
  }
}

CONSTRAINTS
- General
  - user_name ∈ users keys
  - user_id ∈ {"USR100","USR101","USR102","USR103","USR104","USR105"}
  - phone_number format: "NNN-NNN-NNNN"
  - time format: "YYYY-MM-DD"
  - inbox capacity: len(inbox) ≤ max_capacity
  - message_id assignment: message_id_counter := message_id_counter + 1; use as new key; IDs not reused on delete

- API: _load_scenario(scenario: dict, long_context: bool=False)
  - Input → scenario: { "wifi"?: bool, "logged_in"?: bool }, long_context: bool
  - Effect → sets wifi (default false), logged_in (default true)
  - Return → None

- API: send_message(sender_name: str, receiver_name: str, message: str)
  - Requires → logged_in == true
  - Requires → wifi == true
  - Requires → len(inbox) < max_capacity
  - Requires → sender_name ∈ users AND receiver_name ∈ users
  - Effect → message_id_counter += 1; inbox[message_id_counter] = { "sender_id": users[sender_name].user_id, "receiver_id": users[receiver_name].user_id, "message": message }
  - Note → no "time" field is set for newly sent messages
  - Returns (success) → { "status": true, "message": "Message successfully sent to <receiver_name>." }
  - Returns (errors) →
    - not logged in → { "status": false, "message": "Device not logged in, unable to send message" }
    - wifi off → { "status": false, "message": "Wi-Fi is turned off, cannot send messages at this time" }
    - capacity full → { "status": false, "message": "Inbox capacity is full. You need to ask the user which message to delete." }
    - unknown user → { "status": false, "message": "Sender or receiver does not exist" }

- API: delete_message(message_id: int)
  - Requires → logged_in == true
  - Requires → message_id ∈ inbox
  - Effect → del inbox[message_id]
  - Returns (success) → { "status": true, "message": "Message ID <message_id> has been successfully deleted." }
  - Returns (errors) →
    - not logged in → { "status": false, "message": "Device not logged in, unable to delete message" }
    - message_id missing → { "status": false, "message": "Message ID does not exist" }

- API: view_messages_between_users(sender_name: str, receiver_name: str)
  - Requires → logged_in == true
  - Requires → sender_name ∈ users
  - Requires → receiver_name ∈ users
  - Behavior → filters inbox where msg.sender_id == users[sender_name].user_id AND msg.receiver_id == users[receiver_name].user_id (one direction only)
  - Returns (success) → { "status": true, "messages": [ { "id": int, "sender": sender_name, "receiver": receiver_name, "message": str }, ... ] }
  - Returns (errors) →
    - not logged in → { "status": false, "message": "Device not logged in, unable to view message information" }
    - sender missing → { "status": false, "message": "Sender does not exist" }
    - receiver missing → { "status": false, "message": "Receiver does not exist" }
    - no results → { "status": false, "message": "No related message records found" }

- API: search_messages(user_name: str, keyword: str)
  - Requires → user_name ∈ users
  - Behavior → case-insensitive substring search in msg.message where msg.sender_id == users[user_name].user_id OR msg.receiver_id == users[user_name].user_id
  - Returns (success) → { "status": true, "messages": [ { "id": int, "sender_id": str, "receiver_id": str, "message": str }, ... ] }
  - Returns (errors) →
    - user missing → { "status": false, "message": "User does not exist" }
    - no matches → { "status": false, "message": "No messages found containing the keyword" }
  - Note → no logged_in or wifi checks

- API: get_all_message_times_with_ids()
  - Requires → logged_in == true
  - Requires → every inbox[ID] contains key "time"
  - Returns (success) → { <message_id:int>: <time:str>, ... }
  - Returns (errors) →
    - not logged in → { "status": false, "message": "Device not logged in, unable to retrieve all message times and their corresponding message IDs." }
  - Note → If any message lacks "time", runtime error occurs (not handled)

- API: get_latest_message_id()
  - Requires → logged_in == true
  - Requires → inbox not empty
  - Requires → every inbox[ID] contains "time" formatted "YYYY-MM-DD"
  - Behavior → parses times and selects max time; returns corresponding message_id
  - Returns (success) → { "status": true, "message": "The latest message ID is <id>", "message_id": <id:int> }
  - Returns (errors) →
    - not logged in → { "status": false, "message": "Device not logged in, unable to retrieve the latest sent message ID." }
    - inbox empty → { "status": false, "message": "No message records found" }
  - Note → If any message lacks "time", runtime error may occur

- API: get_earliest_message_id()
  - Requires → logged_in == true
  - Requires → inbox not empty
  - Requires → every inbox[ID] contains "time" formatted "YYYY-MM-DD"
  - Behavior → parses times and selects min time; returns corresponding message_id
  - Returns (success) → { "status": true, "message": "The earliest message ID is <id>", "message_id": <id:int> }
  - Returns (errors) →
    - not logged in → { "status": false, "message": "Device not logged in, unable to retrieve the earliest sent message ID." }
    - inbox empty → { "status": false, "message": "No message records found" }
  - Note → If any message lacks "time", runtime error may occur

- Operational Notes
  - Initial state: len(inbox) == max_capacity (6) → send_message will fail with capacity error until at least one message is deleted
  - Content consistency is not validated (message text may not align with sender/receiver semantics)
  - Directional filtering: view_messages_between_users does not include reverse direction unless explicitly queried
